quest.name: Eyes on Me
journal: Marques believes he is being watched.

Marques cannot shake the feeling that he is being watched. Apparently, the sensation comes and goes, but he felt it quite strongly not long ago. Put his fears to rest by searching the surrounding area for hidden onlookers.

While patrolling the lichyard, you come under attack from an unknown assailant. After slaying the man in self-defense, you note that his sword is unlike any you have seen before, and retrieve it in the hope that it might serve to identify him. Inform Marques that his fears were justified.

Marques has no idea why the man would be monitoring his activities, but he suspects it may have something to do with his past─a past which he still cannot recall, despite his best efforts. As this may not be the last time dangerous men come in search of Marques, he asks that you inform Father Iliud of everything that has transpired. Perhaps you should show him the unusual sword you discovered as well.

Recognizing the sword you found to be Garlean steel, Father Iliud concludes that the man observing Marques was an imperial soldier. Before he can dispatch you to inform the authorities, Alphinaud Leveilleur strides into the church and declares Marques to be none other than Master Cid Garlond, who has been missing since the Calamity five years ago. While he has yet to recover his lost memories, Cid senses that the boy speaks the truth, and decides to join him. Resigned, Father Iliud produces Cid's belongings, which the priest had stored for safekeeping. Alphinaud then reveals that the Ixal have summoned Garuda, and that Cid's lost airship, the Enterprise, will be required if the surviving Scions are to reach the primal. Together with Cid and Alphinaud, make for Gridania, where the Enterprise was last seen.
objectives: Search the lichyard for unseen observers.
Show the sword to Father Iliud.

dialogue.name: MARQUEZ
dialogue.text: I...I'm not imagining it, Forename. I know I'm being watched...

dialogue.name: MARQUEZ
dialogue.text: This is different─sinister. It is as if I am...under observation.

dialogue.name: MARQUEZ
dialogue.text: The feeling comes and goes...but I felt it when last I ventured outside. Yes. I know I felt it. Will you look outside for me...please? It will only take a moment.

dialogue.name: MARQUEZ
dialogue.text: You were attacked, weren't you? Are you unharmed? Thank the gods.

dialogue.name: MARQUEZ
dialogue.text: I knew it. He was watching me. ...But why was he watching me?

dialogue.name: MARQUEZ
dialogue.text: What did he want with me? Did he, perhaps...know something of my past? If only I could have asked him...

dialogue.name: MARQUEZ
dialogue.text: I...I need to think. Please, allow me a moment alone. Wait. Father Iliud must hear of this. Will you tell him for me? It's important. I think others may come for me again.

dialogue.name: ILIUD
dialogue.text: Heavens forfend... That such a thing should happen on holy ground! Do you have any idea who this man was? Did you notice anything distinctive about his garb or possessions?

dialogue.name: ILIUD
dialogue.text: This...this is Garlean steel. Which means the man who was watching Marques was...

dialogue.name: ILIUD
dialogue.text: Make haste to Camp Drybone at once! We must summon the Immortal Flames before more imperials come!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Hmph. I fondly hoped that I might be the first to speak with you... Would that I had been so fortunate.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: At ease, adventurer─I come not on behalf of the Empire. On the contrary, I mean to revive the Scions of the Seventh Dawn.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: And to that end...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I have come in search of a legend─the greatest engineer of our time. Master Cid Garlond─I have come for you.

dialogue.name: PRIEST
dialogue.text: I fear you are mistaken, child. He is but a poor soul who bore witness to the horrors at Carteneau.

dialogue.name: PRIEST
dialogue.text: I beg of you, leave us in peace...

dialogue.name: MARQUEZ
dialogue.text: Wait... I...

dialogue.name: MARQUEZ
dialogue.text: <groan>

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Hear me, Cid! Eorzea needs you!

dialogue.name: MARQUEZ
dialogue.text: You... So familiar... We... It's... all a blur.

dialogue.name: MARQUEZ
dialogue.text: <groan>

dialogue.name: PRIEST
dialogue.text: Cid, was it? Here...these belong to you.

dialogue.name: PRIEST
dialogue.text: I thought you bore the mark of greatness... It seems that I was right.

dialogue.name: PRIEST
dialogue.text: Our time together was all too brief, but it felt as though my son had returned to me. You have brought joy to an old man's life.

dialogue.name: PRIEST
dialogue.text: But it is time for you to help those who truly need you.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: (-Cid-)Who...are you?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Alphinaud Leveilleur, at your service.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: As a Scion of the Seventh Dawn, I stand against our primal and imperial foes─as my grandfather once did.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: 'Tis no secret what befell our order at the Waking Sands. Word has already spread across Eorzea.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The repercussions are far greater than you realize. In the wake of the Calamity, the three city–states focused their efforts solely on reconstruction.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Leaving the Scions to combat the primal threat unaided.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: And lo, we are all but destroyed. Yet even as the nations mourn our demise, and abandon what little hope they have left, we cannot forsake our duty─now least of all.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The Ixal have summoned Garuda once more, and she torments the people of Coerthas as we speak.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Her appetite for destruction far exceeds that of other primals.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Worse, in her present incarnation, our Baldesion colleagues believe she surpasses both Ifrit and Titan in strength.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Yet therein lies an opportunity. Were we somehow to defeat Garuda, it would serve as a warning to the other beast tribes that even their mightiest gods can be felled.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: If we are to face our foe, we must first circumvent the tempest that shields her sanctuary.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: And for that, we need an airship─your airship, Cid.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: (-Cid-)I...I have...an airship?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Yes, Cid, you do. Your very own airship.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: It was last seen in the skies over Gridania, not long before the Calamity, so let us begin our search there.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: (-Cid-)A-An airship...? My airship...?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: (-Cid-)W-Wait...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Come, let us put an end to the primals! Together, we will show the world that the Scions are still a force to be reckoned with!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: They need my airship... They need...me.

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: You are being watched...

obj.n: Bury Me Not on the Lone Prairie
